citeinfo.origin: Russian Academy of Science, Institute of Lithosphere, Staromonetny per. 22, Moscow
citeinfo.title: Diatom Assemblages from the Pliocene-Pleistocene Boundary Beds in Kamchatka, Russia

descript.abstract: The identification of North Pacific diatom assemblages in the Olkhovian Formation of eastern Kamchatka and their correlation with the paleomagnetic time scale allows accurate placement of the Pliocene-Pleistocene boundary in the Kamchatka region. Analysis of the composition of the diatom flora makes possible a paleogeographic reconstruction of the shelf region in the western Bering Sea during the latest Pliocene and early Pleistocene.
descript.purpose: To show the diatom assemblages from the Pliocene-Pleistocene boundary beds in Kamchatka, Russia
